name: Hyperelliptic curve
summary:
In algebraic geometry, a hyperelliptic curve is an algebraic curve of genus g > 1, given by an equation of the form

  
    
      
        
          y
          
            2
          
        
        +
        h
        (
        x
        )
        y
        =
        f
        (
        x
        )
      
    
    {\displaystyle y^{2}+h(x)y=f(x)}
  

where f(x) is a polynomial of degree n = 2g + 1 > 4 or n = 2g + 2 > 4 with n distinct roots, and h(x) is a polynomial of degree < g + 2 (if
